content.text: The school employs a proactive approach to risk management to protect the safety of students, staff, and assets. All significant activities require a formal risk assessment.

steps.title: Identify
steps.desc: Identify potential hazards associated with an activity or area.

steps.title: Assess
steps.desc: Evaluate the likelihood and severity of harm (Risk Matrix).

steps.title: Control
steps.desc: Implement measures to eliminate or reduce the risk to an acceptable level.

steps.title: Review
steps.desc: Monitor the effectiveness of controls and update as necessary.

content.text: Clear, practiced procedures are in place for various emergency scenarios. Drills are conducted regularly.

content.title: Standard Drills
rows: Evacuate immediately to designated assembly point. Take attendance.
Drop, Cover, and Hold On. Evacuate when shaking stops.
Lock doors, cover windows, lights off, silence, hide out of sight.
First aid by qualified staff; call ambulance if critical.

content.text: Field trips and excursions extend learning but carry specific risks. Strict approval processes apply.

content.title: Requirements
items: Risk Assessment: Completed by Trip Leader and approved by Principal.
Parental Consent: Signed permission forms with medical details.
Ratios: Adequate staff-to-student ratios based on age and activity risk.
First Aid: First aid kit and trained staff member must accompany all trips.

content.text: In a crisis, accurate and timely communication is vital to maintain trust and calm.

items: Spokesperson: Only the Principal or designated Board member speaks to the media.
Channels: SMS/WhatsApp blast for urgent alerts; Email for detailed updates.
Privacy: No names of injured/affected individuals are released without family consent.
